results.title: Harmony Row
results.creator_credit: Efftee Film Productions and Frank Thring
results.brief_description: This production stars George Wallace as a policeman who is assigned to Harmony Row, a notorious haunt of thugs and criminals. On the beat he makes many friends and is finally persuaded to fight Slogger Lee, the biggest trouble maker in Harmony Row, in a boxing tournament.

results.title: Harmony in music
results.brief_description: Elementary students in a school ensemble and in a chorus learn how harmony enriches music. The music leader demonstrates the relationship of harmony to chords, explains how chords are built, and how harmony enhances melody and rhythm. The principles of harmony and chords are demonstrated on an actual piano keyboard, with charts, with instruments and with group singing.

results.title: Harmonie
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Bonnie Sherr Klein and Dorothy Rosenberg
results.brief_description: A gentle blend of music, people and nature; a summer camp where melodies ripple off the waves and rhythms bounce out of the shadows. Every Summer since 1953, CAMMAC (Canadian Amateur Musicians/Musiciens Amateurs du Canada) has held a bilingual Music camp in Quebec’s Laurentian Mountains. Here, people of all ages and levels of Musical ability come together to learn and make music with a professional staff of Canadian and international musicians.

results.title: Harmonic motion
results.brief_description: Surveys many timekeeping and other examples of harmonic motion and resonance. Shows how timekeeping let to improvements in our knowledge of harmonic motion. Also notes some mathematical applications.

results.title: Harm hides at home
results.creator_credit: Film Company of America, S Tapper and Karl H. Dempwolf
results.brief_description: Safety Woman is involved in the rescue of children from potentially dangerous situations in the home. After each rescue she discusses the rules of home safety with the children. Covers fire, guns, ladders, stairways, spills and the storage of toxic household products.

results.title: Harlow New Town
results.brief_description: In a visit to Harlow, one of britain’s new “satellite” towns, Christopher Chataway discusses this modern building experiment with Frederick Gibberd, Harlow’s architect-planner, and interviews a number of people living and working in the town.

results.title: Harlequin
results.creator_credit: Antony Ginnane, FG Films, Far Flight and Simon Wincer
results.brief_description: An influential politician and his wife fall prey to a man who saves the life of their son. He is a hypnotic faith healer called Wolf “The Harlequin” and his powers of manipulation are strong. A chief political adviser to the the politican attempts to remove “The Harlequin” and lessen his power but is confronted by a being with strong supernnatural powers. The climax is filled with unbelievable tension and terror. Starring David Hemmings, Robert Powell, Broderick Crawford and Carmen Duncan.

results.title: Harlequin
results.brief_description: A series of animated stories by various students at the Newton Creative Arts Center. Called the Yellow Ball Workshop and instructed by Yvonne Anderson some of the shorts are: Red Cat by Daniel Sterne; Fountain Fantasie by Tamara Hurwitz; Evolution Now by Fred Allen; A Joy Ride by Pamela Gilfillan and Rock of Ages by Stephen Wren.

results.title: Harlem Wednesday
results.creator_credit: Edward Harrison, Story Board, John Hubley and Faith Hubley
results.brief_description: Using the paintings of the American artist Gregario Prestopino, the camera explores life in Harlem throughout the day and late into the night. With jazz accompaniment and clever editing, the film epitomises the life of the people and the atmosphere of their environment. Harlem Wednesday won an award at the Venice Film Festival.
